sentence: Consumer shares were mixed ahead of the opening bell Tuesday.

In consumer stocks news, Home Depot ( HD ) was up 0.1% after the company reported Q2 earnings of $1.97 per share, in line with the Capital IQ consensus estimate and up compared with the prior-year period's $1.73 per share.
Revenue was $26.47 billion, up 6.6% from $24.83 billion in the same quarter last year.
The Street view was for revenue of $26.49 billion.
Comparable store sales for the quarter were higher 4.7%.
The company reaffirmed its FY16 sales guidance and expects sales will be up 6.3% and comp sales will be up 4.9%.
It also raised its diluted earnings-per-share guidance for the year and now expects diluted EPS to grow 15.6% year over year to $6.31, matching analysts' estimates.
The prior guidance was for EPS of $6.27.
And, Dick's Sporting Goods Inc. ( DKS ) was up 8.0% after reporting Q2 EPS of $0.82, compared to $0.77 in the year-ago quarter, and beating the Capital IQ forecast of $0.69.
Revenues for the quarter ended July 30 were $1.97 billion, up from $1.82 billion a year earlier, and ahead of the analyst forecast of $1.89 billion.

The company said that it expects full-year 2016 earnings per diluted share in a range of $2.90 to $3.05, above the $2.84 average estimate, and Q3 earnings per diluted share of $0.39 to $0.42, above the $0.38 consensus.
Dick's also said it expects to open approximately 25 new stores and relocate four existing stores in Q3, and 36 new stores and nine relocations for the year.
The views and opinions expressed herein are the views and opinions of the author and do not necessarily reflect those of Nasdaq, Inc.
